ratings.comment: This guy is top notch! He really knows is stuff , invested in his students and the topics he teaches about. He is approachable. Yes, there is quite a bit of reading and discussion based on it. However, if you show up for class and participate in discussion , pay attention it helps quite a bit on exams. Wish I could have him for every class

Music, Movies, & the '60s was the best class I have ever taken at UW. Craig is so caring, knowledgeable, and cool. He assigns a lot of books but I just read the sparknotes and still got a good grade. Craig has a lot of guests come in and plays a lot of music and movies. Always go to movie nights! The movies are not that great but the pizza is.

Far and away one of the top professors at UW. Craig's knowledge of history, music, politics, culture, race, and much else, is vast to say the least.  If you actually come to school to learn, you will.  Make sure to meet him outside of classes as well-- he's one who will actually listen to you.
I left every class just blown away, in a good way. You will learn a ton, and a lot of it won't be about textbook stuff really but about really deep issues. Lots of reading!
Craig is so knowledgable and is a great professor.  so kind and easy to talk to.
Craig is amazing! The best professor I have ever had and every lecture is very intriguing. Highly recommend.
One of the most profound professors I have ever had.  Every class you come away with deep insight into more than just the subject, but life in general.  Highly recommend.

The Vietnam Era was not structured to my liking, and lectures were hit-or-miss. Guest speakers were awesome, and there are great people on the teaching team. Craig is an really intelligent guy and is fascinating to talk to. He knows his stuff and is clearly passionate about the material. Heavy reading!!

Craig is my favorite professor in all of my college experience! He is very interesting and he is a great professor for creative minded people. I got a lot out of his lectures and discussion. He really understands what it's like to be a student.
Craig Werner is the man! Absolute brilliance!

I walked away from almost every lecture impressed with Craig's teaching ability. He's organized, understands that everyone has a different learning style, and incredibly invested in the class and the material he teaches. Midterm and exam are projects; discussions are always engaging. Craig is a genius.

Craig is awesome. If you have the opportunity to take ILS 275 about the Vietnam War, definitely do it. One of the best classes I've ever taken. Lots of reading, but midterm and final are projects. Overall, extremely valuable class, highly recommend.

Very clear teacher, definitely knows what he's talking about. Class is really easy if you just go and listen and do the readings. He makes it very interesting and thought-provoking. In Afro American Lit there was not too much reading, but other classes might be different.

Theres a ton of reading required but the books r interesting.Hes interactive,intelligent,lenient, and understanding, but doesnt care for slackers.If ur a deep thinker and creative-minded this is def a class for u. Craig is open minded to peoples opinions and perspectives which makes the class fun, but assigns a semi-unreasonable amount of reading.

Fantastic Professor!  He was very understanding and relaxed.  I had his ILS 400-ish class when 9/11 occurred.  (It's been a while, I apologize for not remembering the exact class).  He helped us look at the events of the day in a way that no other professor could.  Professor Werner is a smart man.  Listen carefully, you'll learn tons from him.
Amazing prof. Best I've ever had. Make the effort to get to know him. Go Werner!!

Only take this class if you really like to read.  He assigns abouts 200 pages for each class.  I'm not really sure what he does because his TA graded our exams and he bases his classes off student comments. Tough class if you are a freshman or sophmore, maybe better to take as a senior english major.
Awesome professor, easily my favorite class of college so far. A lot of reading, but if you keep up with it, the class is relatively easy. Very interesting, really stimulating.

great reading list assignments, each book amazing. craig is very lenient and understanding, but prioritizes the important things. let me rewrite midterm essay for partial credit, but is a stickler for attendance and participation. understands class is about learning and not about the grades. awesome class and teacher.

Not enough room here (...American Cultural History)! The man: excellent, generous, compassionate, passionate, energetic. Uses lots of media: CDs, DVDs, dancers, speakers. You will learn a lot and have a great final project.
Best teacher I had in grad school.  Passionate, knowledgeable, funny.  Gave more detailed and helpful feedback on my writing than I got anywhere else.
No Comments

I thought he was cool at first, then i realized he didnt know anything he was talking about, the only person worse then him was his ta for afro am eric, it was painful to have two classes with him...funny can only be descriptive of how he recieved his phd
You can't get a much better prof than Craig.  And it's really cool (and kinda funny) that he prefers not to wear shoes!

awsome prof awsome guy! Never a dull moment in his class and he seems to be able to answer any question or comment on anything brought up in class. I highly recommend taking a class of his and if its not small -go to his office hours and talk to him because he's very cool.
awsome teacher and awsome guy!

What an amazing guy. He certainly does not offer any cruise classes, but the amount of knowledge one gains in his classes makes up for the workload. And he's on the Rock And Roll Hall of Fame nominating committee! Great guy to talk to about music!

By far the most challenging course I have taken in college.  Professor is a good speaker but not very accepting of students questions.  It's a tough Comm B class, but it's well worth taking, and it will make your writing improve by leaps and bounds.
Great class, great reading list, incredible professor
No Comments
